full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/25/2023 Form FS-510 (English) (2-68) Page 4 42. Yes To No Were you assisted in completing this application? (If answer is Yes, give name and address of person assisting you indicating whether relative, friend, travel agent, agent, attorney, or other) to Name the Address Relationship Do not write below the following line The consular officer will assist you in answering parts 43 and 44 43. I claim to be exempt from ineligibility to receive a visa and exclusion under item reasons: in part 41 for the following 44 I claim to be a preference immigrant subject to the numerical limitation for Special immigrant subject to Western Hemisphere numerical limitation (foreign state or dependent area) Special immigrant not subject to limitation Immediate relative of a United States citizen My claim is based on the following facts: I am the father of an American citizen. Visa petition approved at Los Angeles, Calif. on 27 Oct. 1972. I understand that I am required to surrender my visa to the United States Immigration Officer at the place where I apply to enter the United States, and that the possession of a visa does not entitle me to enter the United States if at that time I am found to be inadmissible under the immigration laws. I understand that any willfully false or misleading statement or willful concealment of a material fact made by me herein to criminal prosecution and/or deportation, may subject me to permanent exclusion from the United States and, if I am admitted to the United States, may subject me I, the undersigned applicant for a United States immigrant visa, do solemnly swear (or affirm) that all statements which appear in. this application have been made by me. including the answers to parts 33 through 42 inclusive, and are true and complete to the best of my knowledge and belief. I do further swear (or affirm) that, if admitted into the United States, I will not engage in activities which would be prejudicial to the public interest, or endanger the welfare, safety, or security of the United States: in activities which would be prohibited by the laws of the United States relating to espionage, sabotage, public disorder, or in other activities subversive to the national security; in any activity a purpose of which is the opposition to, or the control, or overthrow of, the Government of the United States, by force, violence, or other unconstitutional means; or join, affiliate with, or participate in the activities of any organization which is registered or required to be registered under Section 7 of the Subversive Activities Control Act of 1950. I understand all the foregoing statements, having asked for and obtained an explanation on every point which was not clear to me. corrections numbered 1 through part of my application. only th (Signature of Applicant) A Subscribed and sworn to before me this 27 of March (Tar tem No.) war 19 73 mother (Fee J.S. $ 5.00) of : (L ') CY Equiv.) (Consular Officer)
